ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I improved my Hebrew presentation skills and time management skills this semester, and learned a lot of Hebrew grammar.
I learned how to use the future tense as well as enhance my writing and communication skills in Hebrew.
I developed my skills of conversation Hebrew, learned a lot of very useful conjunctions, and learned how to speak in the future tense!
A lot. Great course. Learned how to speak Hebrew. Really amazing professor.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The small class size makes the environment very conducive to learning. I think the course does a good job of covering Hebrew language, especially grammar, but in a fun and engaging way with a good use of technology and pop culture resources.
The regular meetings and daily assignments make it a language routine which is very important in order to make progress in Hebrew.
i really think that the course was useful in helping me speak better. I did not really like the social business project.
Strengths were how multimedia was used so often.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this class to a student at this Hebrew level who is on the fence about continuing - it is a manageable and enjoyable 5th class.
I would recommend this course to any student who is looking to better their Hebrew skills !
Yes. Such an engaging and incredible course.
